p: Thirty clinical MRSA isolates were collected from King Abdulaziz Specialist Hospital, Taif, Saudi Arabia. The isolates were identified as S. aureus, as described previously [ 49]. The methicillin resistance phenotype was performed by the Vitek 2 system (bioMÃ©rieux, Durham, North CA, USA) in accordance with the British Society for Antimicrobial Chemotherapy (BSAC). Each isolate was considered as methicillin-resistant when the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) breakpoint of oxacillin was >2 mg/L and cefoxitin >4 mg/L. [ 50]. S. aureus ATCC 25922 was used as control.
